list.name: Default Changelist
list.comment: Switch the pluginLoader to use PF4J, switch serialization to Moshi, heavily refactor interfaces.kt, switch all gradle files to the Kotlin DSL.

task.summary: Default task
Add read status to stage 1.
Specify what I'm talking about in stage 1.
Write interfaces from stage1Research.md, write method headers for functions from stage2Research.md.
Switch open classes to abstract, since that makes more sense.
Initially implement command parser, command registration, remove protocol from interfaces where it can be inferred from User or Chat.
Implement insertion of escaped chars into command string, add test.
Make command parser tests pass.
Implement aliases, switch to universalChat.
Remove unnecessary exceptions, optimize parsing non-commands, update research.
Merge with master.
Implement runCommand.
Start implementing default commands.
Refactor Protocol class, add replaceAliasVars.
Fix up gradle dependencies, implement JCL correctly, set up test to load a plugin.
Make working classLoader implementation, adjust test accordingly.
Create main, rename classLoader to PluginLoader, refactor its test.
Remove files that shouldn't be tracked by git, add interface callbacks.
Implement Scheduler for the schedule command.
Implemented SchedulerThread, made bot runnable from gradle.
Remove serialization stuff, add Klaxon as a library.
Replace serialization with Klaxon, add build instructions.
Allow pluginLoader to load more than one plugin.
Update documentation to reflect classloader change.
Make sure the class loaded is actually a plugin.
Set up skeleton code for discord and messenger plugins.
Clean up default generated comments in discord and messenger plugins.
Write initial implementation for Discord plugin. Untested.
Update build script for discordPlugin so it builds correctly.
Add try around Discord's sendMessage so it sends correctly.
Update documentation.
Replace all usages of LocalDateTime with OffsetDateTime.
Set up serializers for necessary classes.
Set up serializers for necessary classes.
Set up serializers for necessary classes.
Set up serializers for necessary classes.
Start setting up serializers for discord plugin.
Updated TODO.md, added CommandSerializer.

Convert MessengerPlugin to using a JS library and Nashorn.
The JS library and all of its dependencies are bundled into one file and converted to ES5 using babel, which is then put into the MessengerPlugin's resources folder. The PluginLoader then loads it when it loads the plugin. None of the JS code is written yet.
Set up kotlin functions to mirror the functions exposed through the unofficial facebook api.
Make Plugin loading add stuff first before doing any loading to avoid duplicating work, fix protocol registration.

Make Plugin loading add stuff first before doing any loading to avoid duplicating work, fix protocol registration.
- Plugin loading was scanning through every loaded file every time a plugin was loaded, which is pretty slow. Originally, this was fine, since only one directory of plugins was being added anyway, so it wasn't a big deal. I would rather not do that, and instead add everything before loading plugins so it's guaranteed to only go through once. - Protocol registration did not check for duplicates properly before, which it now does, thanks to it having a default implementation of HashCode and Equals, courtesy of IntelliJ. This also meant the code in BasicPlugin and ConsolePlugin checking if their protocol was registered needed to be removed, since it's not really the plugin's job to check if it got loaded properly, it's the loader's. - TODO.md was updated to reflect the current progress on the Messenger Plugin.
Add .idea folder to .gitignore.
Make plugin threads accessible globally.
Replace commandParser with an ANTLRv4 based parser.

Remove kotlinx.serialization, replace with a JSON-based serialization method with less magic.
Less magic means the dynamic class loading mechanisms will cause less issues, plus the code is actually very easy to write, easier than the equivalent kotlinx.serialization code, and to maintain, since this code does not depend on any library besides Klaxon (and switching that out would be simple)

Remove kotlinx.serialization, replace with a JSON-based serialization method with less magic.
Less magic means the dynamic class loading mechanisms will cause less issues, plus the code is actually very easy to write, easier than the equivalent kotlinx.serialization code, and to maintain, since this code does not depend on any library besides Klaxon (and switching that out would be simple)

Remove kotlinx.serialization, replace with a JSON-based serialization method with less magic.
Less magic means the dynamic class loading mechanisms will cause less issues, plus the code is actually very easy to write, easier than the equivalent kotlinx.serialization code, and to maintain, since this code does not depend on any library besides Klaxon (and switching that out would be simple)
Switch the pluginLoader to use PF4J, switch serialization to Moshi, heavily refactor interfaces.kt, switch all gradle files to the Kotlin DSL.

- Plugin loading was scanning through every loaded file every time a plugin was loaded, which is pretty slow. Originally, this was fine, since only one directory of plugins was being added anyway, so it wasn't a big deal. I would rather not do that, and instead add everything before loading plugins so it's guaranteed to only go through once. - Protocol registration did not check for duplicates properly before, which it now does, thanks to it having a default implementation of HashCode and Equals, courtesy of IntelliJ.
